ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I overall enjoyed this course and the material, instructor was hilarious, as long as you read the book thoroughly the course is fair and useful.

This course is undoubtedly a must-take if you are an organic chemistry student. You cannot learn such interesting and useful knowledge from someone better than Prof. Crabtree. Also, although his book is somewhat expensive, but I strongly recommend everyone who is taking this course to buy one. It would help you through the course and it will definitely be a great reference if you want to re-study organometallics within a short period of time.

A comprehensive introduction to the field of organometallic chemistry. Absolutely indispensable for anyone who intends to study catalysis, and a beneficial primer for other organic chemists planning to use transition metals in their research.
I would recommend this course to another student.
It's helpful for students interested in TM study.
sure, very helpful, learn a lot.

Chemistry 552 runs the gamut of organometallic chemistry, emphasizing simple but predictive principles like the 18 electron rule and ligand field theory to rationalize a variety of chemical phenomena. I would recommend the course to any student interested in organometallic chemistry.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I'm an inorganic student so this course helped me understand more about the field.
I learned a great deal in this course, most of the learning was on my own, from reading the book. Class meetings were not too helpful
This course is a thorough introduction of the organometallic chemistry and I am currently working on a related project and this really helps me a lot. Thank you Prof. Crabtree!
Definitely learned a lot, especially since I have never taken inorganic chemistry. Very useful to learn about the general aspects of organometallic reactions, and of metals.

The course reviewed some content I had seen previously and went over a variety of topics I was unfamiliar with. Because I'm studying in an inorganic/organometallic research group, this course is of immediate relevance to my research.
